result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Theodore P Gilbert

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

[ma] Cases 22CF110, 22CF309, 22CT118 called at 8:48 AM 
Defendant Theodore P Gilbert in court.  Attorney Justin Singleton appears with Defendant Theodore Gilbert on Case 22CF110 only. Attorney Krysta Parson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Right to counsel is given; the Defendant waives this right; the Court accepts this waiver and finds him competent to represent himself in Cases 22CF309 & 22CT118.

As to Case 22CF309, Waiver of Preliminary Hearing & Arraignment occur: 
Mr. Gilbert waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charge and maximum penalties are recited
--plea of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

Scheduling of all cases discussed. 
recess: 8:54am 

NEXT:   Status Conference on 12/1/22 at 2:30pm
Status conference on October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Cases 22CF110, 22CF309 and 22CT118 at 10:06 AM.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant Theodore P Gilbert in court. 22CF110 ONLY - Atty. Singleton appears on behalf of the Defendant.  Attorney Shock in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court reviews rights regarding counsel on cases 22CF309 and 22CT118, 
Scheduling issues addressed by the Court and Counsel. 
Court requests that Atty. Singleton inform the Court if he becomes aware that the PH will be a waiver. 
Recess 10:10am

NEXT - (notices to be mailed.)
22CF309 only - PH - 10/4/22 at 8:30am
22CF309 and 22CT118 - STC - 10/4/22 at 8:30am
Status conference on September 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

[ma] Cases 22CF110 & 22CT118 called at 11:03 AM 
Defendant Theodore P Gilbert in court with Attorney Justin L. Singleton(as to Case 22CF110).  Monica J. Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court reviews court record. 
Atty Gilbert requests an additional status; gives basis. 
--no objection from DA Hall

recess: 11:06am 
NEXT: Status on 9/1/22 at 10:00am
Status conference on June 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

[ma] Cases 22CF110 & 22CT118 called at 8:42am 
Defendant Theodore P Gilbert in court with Attorney Justin L. Singleton(in Case 22CF110).  Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Initial Appearance occurs in Case 22CT118:
The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Defendant stands mute, pleas of "Not Guilty" are entered; speedy trial is waived by the Defendant.
Right to Counsel reviewed.

The Court requires a $350  Signature Bond with condition:
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license

Preliminary Hearing occurs in Case 22CF110:
Sergeant Caucutt -sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Parson
Parties stipulate to the existance of a prior felony conviction
--cross examination by Attorney Singleton
--questioning by the Court 
--redirect examination by ADA Parson
--recross examination by Attorney Singleton

Arguments given by Counsel

The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Gilbert committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess: 9:25am 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference to occur informally  (2) Status Conference on 6/23/22 at 10:00am

Pre-trial conference on April 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ml] Case called at 2:26PM
Defendant Theodore P Gilbert in court, without counsel. ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Upon Court inquiry, the Defendant advises that he has hired private counsel. 
The Court recesses to allow for the Defendant to contact the attorney and arrange for his appearance.
recess 2:28pm

------------------------------------------

reconvene 2:34PM

Att Justin Singleton appears via telephone. All other appearances remain the same.
Att Singleton advises that he has been retained by the Defendant. Att Singleton advises that a organization error prevented his appearance today.
The Court orders the Defense to file a Notice of Retainer.
The State advises that file 22CT118 is scheduled for an Initial Appearance this upcoming Monday. The State requests that hearing be removed and set for scheduling with this file.
The Court removes the 03/21 Initial Appearance from the Commissioner's calendar and sets it for Initial Appearance in Branch III at the next scheduled date.
Upon Court inquiry, Att Singleton advises that he has not been retained on the Defendant's traffic file.

recess 2:41PM

NEXT: 
In file 22CF110:
(1) Pretrial Conference on 04/13 at 10:00AM   
(2) Preliminary Hearing on 04/14 at 8:30AM with in person appearances
In file 22CT118:
(3) Initial Appearance on 04/14 at 8:30AM with in person appearances
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
Status conference on March 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession of dangerous weapons
--maintain absolute sobriety

[ma] Case called at 1:23 PM 
Defendant Theodore P Gilbert appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD appears for bond-purposes only).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $1200  Signature Bond with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession of dangerous weapons
--maintain absolute sobriety
recess 1:27  pm. 

NEXT: Status of Counsel on 3/18/22 at 2:30pm
